title: Installation issue: virtualgl ^libjpeg fails (only seems to work with libjpeg-turbo)
body:
<!-- Thanks for taking the time to report this build failure. To proceed with the report please:

1. Title the issue "Installation issue: <name-of-the-package>".
2. Provide the information required below.

We encourage you to try, as much as possible, to reduce your problem to the minimal example that still reproduces the issue. That would help us a lot in fixing it quickly and effectively! -->

The virtualgl package lists a virtual dependency on 'jpeg', which has providers libjpeg and libjpeg-turbo.   However, virtualgl seems to only be able to build with libjpeg-turbo.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

<!-- Fill in the exact spec you are trying to build and the relevant part of the error message -->
```console
$ spack install virtualgl ^libturbo
```
fails with errors like 
```console
CMake Error at cmakescripts/FindTurboJPEG.cmake:16 (message):
  Could not find turbojpeg.h in /opt/libjpeg-turbo/include.  If it is
  installed in a different place, then set TJPEG_INCLUDE_DIR accordingly.
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  CMakeLists.txt:311 (include)
```

Bulding against libjpeg-turbo, e.g.
```console
$ spack install virtualgl ^libturbo-jpeg
```
is successful.

I made a quick attempt to hack the package.py to set TJPEG_INCLUDE_DIR and TJPEG_LIBRARY to point to the libjpeg include and libraries, but this still generates errors:

```console
    65    -- X Video support disabled (VGL_USEXV = 0)
  >> 66    CMake Error at cmakescripts/FindTurboJPEG.cmake:16 (message):
     67      Could not find turbojpeg.h in
     68      /software/spack-software/2020.05.14/linux-rhel8-ivybridge/gcc-8.4.0/libjpeg-9c-5upfo56ajuvhkiw5krysf43w3jgzzcy4/include.
     69      If it is installed in a different place, then set TJPEG_INCLUDE_DIR
```
since of course libjpeg does not have a turbojpeg.h include.

A simple solution would be to change the dependency from a virtual dependency on jpeg to a concrete dependency on libjpeg-turbo.   A better solution would be to patch the virtualgl build stuff to accept either libjpeg or libjpeg-turbo, but that is more work than I can deal with right now.  I am not sure if other packages have similar issues.

### Information on your system

```console
* **Spack:** 0.14.2
* **Python:** 3.6.8
* **Platform:** linux-rhel8-ivybridge
```
